ourSpecialists.title: Our Specialists
ourSpecialists.subtitle: Psychologist
ourSpecialists.slideText: Will help you understand yourself, deal with anxiety, and overcome inner conflicts.

questions.a: Anxiety is a normal reaction of the body to stress. When it becomes chronic, it can interfere with sleep, concentration, and cause physical symptoms such as rapid heartbeat, sweating, and trembling. Breathing techniques, psychotherapy, and regular physical activity can help.

Depression is characterized by a persistent feeling of sadness, loss of interest in favorite activities, low energy, and changes in appetite and sleep. Therapy, social support, and medication can be helpful.
Panic attacks are sudden episodes of intense fear with physical symptoms: rapid heartbeat, shortness of breath, trembling. Psychotherapy, breathing exercises, and sometimes medication are helpful.
Phobias are irrational fears of certain objects or situations. Gradual exposure, cognitive therapy techniques, and relaxation exercises can help overcome them.
Relationship issues may arise from poor communication, lack of trust, or unclear boundaries. Couples therapy and improving communication skills are often helpful.
Burnout is emotional exhaustion, cynicism, and loss of motivation. Rest, work-life balance, support from others, and psychological help are effective ways to recover.
Low self-esteem is shown through self-criticism and a sense of inadequacy. It can be improved through changing negative beliefs, self-acceptance, and therapy.
Problems with sexual life may be linked to stress, physical health, trauma, or trust issues. Open communication and professional support can be helpful.
Childhood trauma can lead to long-lasting psychological effects such as difficulties with trust and emotional instability. Therapy and trauma-informed approaches can support healing.
Aggression and irritability often arise due to stress, unresolved emotions, or trauma. Anger management techniques, physical activity, and therapy can help.

tests.title: Tests
tests.description: On our website, you can take verified psychological tests that will help you better understand yourself, your strengths, and areas for growth.

specialist.inviteText1: We invite psychologists, psychotherapists, psychiatrists, and organizations to collaborate. We offer a convenient platform for work, promotion, and support.

contact.title: Add yourself or become a partner

about-page.title: About us
about-page.description: Our project is a platform for finding mental health specialists. We strive to help people find qualified specialists by providing a convenient and reliable search. Our mission is to support people's mental health and well-being through access to high-quality specialist care.
about-page.articlesText: Here you will find the story of the project, interviews with the founders, as well as our philosophy and mission: 'Why we created Psychotherapy.uz'.

test-overlay.title: Mini-test: Which specialist should you see?

q1.question: What is most important to you right now?
q1.a2: I want practical advice and techniques
q1.a3: Medical help or medication may be needed

q2.question: How much does this interfere with your life?
q2.a3: It‚Äôs very difficult, hard to cope
q2.a5: I struggle with controlling substance use

q3.question: What do you expect from a specialist?
q3.a1: To talk and better understand myself
q3.a3: Check if medical help or medication is needed
q3.a5: Help with reducing or stopping substance use

q4.question: What else do you notice in yourself?
q4.a3: Suspected mental disorder or medication experience
